definition[0]: the day in March or April when the British Chancellor of the Exchequer makes the Budget speech in Parliament. The Chancellor goes to Parliament carrying the speech in a special red case. The speech is broadcast, and ordinary people take great interest in its effects on such things as the price of petrol, cigarettes, and alcohol.
